Title: Trichy: 10 days on, no inquiry into alleged assault by RJDCE
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

TRICHY: Even after ten days, the higher education department is yet to conduct an inquiry into the alleged physical assault by regional joint director of collegiate education (RJDCE) Trichy S Usha on her subordinate staff.

She has been asked to go on compulsory leave soon after the incident, but no action has been taken on the incident. This is not the first such case. Last April, she was accused of abusing her subordinate staff using filthy language. Then also she was asked to go on compulsory leave. However, she returned to the seat within 15 days without facing any inquiry. Her ‘high-level’ contacts is said to have helped her return without facing any action, said a sources at the RJDCE office.

Meanwhile, the complainants have moved their third memorandum to the chief minister’s cell, director of collegiate education, higher education minister and the secretary.

Speaking to TOI, higher education secretary Apoorva said that Usha has been asked to go on compulsory leave and an inquiry will be initiated in the next few days.

Asked on the delay in initiating the inquiry, she said that the issue could not be discussed because of the busy assembly sessions. The complaints will be considered and necessary action will be initiated.

Members of the Association of University Teachers have also written to the higher education department seeking inquiry into the issue. “Earlier also Usha was reinstated within two weeks after complaints of abuse by staff. This has encouraged her to do physical assault on her staff,” said members of the AUT.

Title: Salem: Namakkal girl gets Rs 2 lakh from Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami for Nasa visit
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Namakkal girl gets Rs 2 lakh

NAMAKKAL: Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami has announced a financial assistance of Rs 2 lakh to a Class IX girl from Nallipalayam in the district for her visit to the American space agency Nasa .

The girl, V Abinaya, daughter of T Venkatachalam, had cleared an online contest that was conducted by a private agency to participate in a space conference scheduled for May this year at Nasa. “To appreciate Abinaya and to encourage the younger generation, I have ordered a sum of Rs 2 lakh for her,” the chief minister said in a statement on Sunday.

Congratulating her, Palaniswami said he was happy to hear about Abinaya’s success in the online contest and her visit to the USA.

A Class IX student of M S Udhayamurthy School of Excellence in Namakkal, Abinaya had appeared for the online contest in September last year. While the results were declared in October, the family was in a fix as they did not have the wherewithal to send her to the USA.

Her father Venkatachalam, a plumber, said, “We were told that the visa, flight fare and other charges alone would come to the tune of Rs 1.8 lakh. So, we had approached the district administration.”

When electricity minister P Thangamani came to know about the girl’s plight, he had given her Rs 2 lakh in December to meet the travel expenses. However, the family required more money to meet other expenses for the seven-day visit and the information was passed on to the chief minister, who has now sanctioned the amount.

The family is now overjoyed. “Abinaya has been told to take a test at Nasa. If she clears that, we were told that she could pursue under graduation in the USA,” her father said.

Title: Death toll in Padra accident rises to 13
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Vadodara: Grief gripped Ranu, Bhoj and Vadu villages of Padra taluka on Sunday as funeral processions of 11 people, who died in an accident between two trucks near Ranu village, were taken out together. Funeral processions of two other deceased were taken out in Fatehgunj area.

The death toll in the accident reached 13 as 17-year-old girl Rizwana Malek succumbed to her injuries in the early hours of Sunday at SSG Hospital.

At Ranu village, the atmosphere was filled with sadness as final rites of seven persons were performed together. One woman from Bhoj village had died while three other deceased were from Vadu. Four passengers continue to be under treatment at SSG Hospital.

On Saturday midnight police registered a case of culpable homicide but not amounting to murder at Padra police station. However, the driver of the dumping truck is still out of police reach.

Title: Int’l week for new academic tie-ups organized at PU
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

The experts were from 4 different nations

Vadodara: In a first of its kind initiative towards internationalization, city-based Parul University (PU) hosted a weeklong international week bringing together academicians from three European countries and Russia.

PU’s department of international relations organized the week, which is designed to promote global academic practices among nations across the world.

The international delegations included experts from Russia, Estonia, Germany and Lithuania.

The event was aimed at widening and strengthening cooperation between PU and institutions across Europe. The experts who took part in the event included professor Nida Macerauskiene, dean of business management, and Alina Katunian, tourism head from Vilniaus Kolegija, University of Applied Sciences, Lithuania.

Professor Mari-Ann Susi and professor Mari Maesaar, summer programme directors from University of Tartu, Estonia along with professor Julian Gollan, research assistant at RUHR West University, Germany and professor Gleb Aleksandrov, international coordinator from ITMO University, Russia were among other experts.

“With ever changing dynamics of the world, it is not only enough to create partnerships but there is a need to continuously reinforce and strengthen these ties to stay in touch with contemporary needs of higher education,” said PU president Dr Devanshu J Patel.

Title: Still no zebra crossing at KTC bus stand in Panaji
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

The zebra crossing prevented buses from speeding through the bus stand

PANAJI: Two years after two passengers were killed while alighting from a bus at the Kadamba Transport Corporation (KTC) bus stand in Panaji, the corporation is yet to ensure the safety of passengers by restoring the zebra crossing that has faded.

A speeding bus hit five passengers inside the KTC bus stand on the morning of February 17, 2018, killing two and injuring three.

The issue was discussed at a round table meet on youth and road safety organised by the Goa consumer action network (Goacan) last week, on the second anniversary of the accident.

After the accident, a site inspection was held by representatives from transport department, traffic police, health services, PWD and the inspection report, which gave recommendations for KTC to follow up on, stated “the central zebra crossing required to be restored URGENTLY”. The main bus stand in Panaji had a zebra crossing that ran from the point where the Dona Paula buses park, and across the bus bays, down to the other end. This would not only force buses to stop at the zebra crossing but also prevented them from parking haphazardly, assuring the public of safe passage right through it.

“The problem arises when one alights or enters from the bus bay where Dona Paula buses are parked and has to walk through the bays to take a Mapusa bus or Margao shuttle bus. The accident took place right in the middle of the bays,” Goacan coordinator Roland Martins said.

KTC chairman Carlos Almeida told TOI, “If it is necessary, we will definitely reinstate it(the zebra crossing)”.

Title: PWD minister orders survey of major Marathwada roads
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

During the survey, conditions of roads leading to important destinations especially those related to commerce,... Read More

AURANGABAD: The public works department ( PWD ) is all set to carry out widening and strengthening of key state highways, district roads for improving connectivity and cutting down the travelling time on roads passing through eight districts of Marathwada .

PWD minister Ashok Chavan on Sunday issued directives for carrying out a detailed survey of key roads from across the region that has often remained neglected in terms of quality roads.

It is for the first time that such a survey is being taken up by the PWD department that focusses only on the key roads, including those passing from rural pockets of Marathwada.

During the survey, conditions of roads leading to important destinations especially those related to commerce, industries, education, religious places would be studied on priority and a detailed proposal for the same will be tabled before the minister.

The minister will then ensure that these roads are developed, widened and strengthened accordingly. As per plan, the roads would be developed on the lines of western Maharashtra which has one of the finest inter-district connectivity in the state.

“Through the survey, condition of the roads connecting to the tehsils would also be studied for preparation and execution of the development plan,” Chavan told TOI.

“The inter-district roads connecting Aurangabad, Nanded, Parbhani, Hingoli, Latur, Beed and Osmanabad need to be strengthened as the region has remained deprived of road strengthening. Many important roads are in bad shape and there have been demands to upgrade these roads to four and six lanes,” he added.

The minister, citing considerable inter-district commuting of vehicles, said the widening of roads in Marathwada region has become essential.

Sources maintained that the minister intends to revamp all important state highways and district roads of the eight districts so that trade and commerce in the region receives a boost.

A PWD official said the development of roads would help farmers in exploring the nearby urban markets, and bag high returns for their farm produce.

Title: Goan engineer’s Solar Switch to automate use of streetlights
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Pilot installations have already been carried out at Porvorim, Curchorem, Ravindra Bhavan, Margao, Konkan Rail... Read More

PANAJI: Streetlights in the state will soon be powered on and off without any manual intervention, thanks to a home-grown invention by an engineer from Carmona . The ‘Solar Switch’, developed by Samson Da Costa, has light-detecting sensors to activate streetlights in the absence of sunlight, and will help save on power bills. Da Costa has bagged a contract to deliver the energy-saving switches, power minister Nilesh Cabral said.

“Invented by a Goan youth, they (Solar Switches) were installed at many places across the state and have given encouraging results. They will now be installed to man streetlights across the state,” said the power minister.

Pilot installations have already been carried out at Porvorim , Curchorem, Ravindra Bhavan, Margao, Konkan Railway quarters, Margao, and Davorlim, and have been successful.

The Solar Switch operates on light intensity, by which it controls the on/ off feature of the unit. “The Solar Switch also comes with an in-built high voltage surge protector,” Da Costa said. Sudden power surges are partly responsible for the malfunctioning of timers on streetlights.

The unit requires no changes to the existing streetlight control panel, and can be fitted onto it. One solar switch connected to the grid box can control up to 200 light poles, Da Costa said.

“The Solar Switch is designed in such a way that the light from a full moon or light from oncoming vehicles will not turn streetlighting off. At the same time, it is configured to stay off during the monsoons when dark clouds cover the sky. It doesn’t come on until it is really dark and falls below two lux light intensity,” he says. “Some installations have been operational for around three years and have been tested in all seasons,” Da Costa said.

The device is also expected to help the government correctly calculate the energy consumption of streetlights, and will be delivered to the government by the end of the month, Da Costa told TOI.

Title: Maharashtra: Tricksters use remote access softwares for UPI app fraud
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: Investigations by the Cybercrime police have revealed that the suspects, who duped 210 people in UPI app fraud since February 15, have misused services of three software — Anydesk, Team Viewer and Quick Support — for creating a mirror image of the electronic devices held by their victims to pull off the fraud.“The mirror image enabled the cheats to access the targeted devices, such as a cellphone or a laptop — from a remote location,” senior inspector Jayram Paygude of the Cybercrime police told TOI.“The suspects would use text messages for randomly sending links of one of the three softwares to people. Many people downloaded these links and shared credentials of their bank accounts or debit cards on the system, which was in control of the suspects,” he said.After obtaining the credentials, the suspects siphoned off the money from the UPI applications of the victims.Paygude said since February 15, many software engineers, elderly persons, house wives and others have lodged complaints stating that money had been siphoned off via their UPI applications after they clicked on the link in the text message they had received.A preliminary probe by the cybercrime police had revealed that the suspects behind the latest online fraud misusing UPI app on cellphones were operating their racket from Kolkata and its adjoining areas in West Bengal. A cybercrime officer said the UPI app company had not sent these messages to the customers. The officer added that people had thought that the link was shared in the text message to update the KYC (Know Your Customer) formalities and clicked on it.Cybercrime expert Sandip Gadiya, who is assisting the cybercrime police in the probe, told TOI, “These are the applications used by the software companies and other firms at large scale to gain access to the remotely located computer, smart television sets or other electronic devices with internet connectivity to upgrade the software and other programmes on the devices.”He said, “It has, however, been increasingly noticed that these software are being used by the cybercrime fraudsters to cheat the people under the pretext of various urgent needs, especially related to the banking facilities. The fraudsters came up with the KYC trick and they have been successful so far,” he said.Gadiya said, “On the receipt of the text message, having link of the software in it, the cell phone owner downloads it and shares the ID number of the downloaded app with the fraudsters. Once the ID number is shared, entire access of the device is gain by the fraudsters. They keep watching device owner’s activities and once the UPI app’s PIN is entered by the suspect, they used it repeatedly to siphon off the money.” He said that despite receiving messages of money being deducted from the account of the UPI app, the device owner hardly can do anything.Lawyer Gaurav Jachak, who specializes in cybercrime cases, told TOI “Majority of the UPI apps do have an in-built system to update KYC of the customers. Instead of looking for the alternative sources, people should study the UPI apps in details and upload their KYC details on the apps on their cellphones. KYC is just a bait to the UPI app users. The location in such cases does not matter. People can manage devices from any part of the world.”He said, “Once the software is downloaded on a device and its ID number is shared, control of the device is automatically handed over to a stranger i.e. the fraudster. It is always better not to download any suspicious link from the messages which the cell phone users receive in the text messages.”

Title: Residents seek SMS alert for notice on property tax dues
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Trichy: The residents of Trichy have sought for the Trichy Corporation to consider sending SMS (short message service) alerts about the property tax dues to the registered mobile numbers of the property owners.

With a section of property owners residing outside the city or even the country by renting out their properties for residential and commercial purposes, the notices sent by the civic body seeking water charge, property tax and underground drainage (UGD) charge reaches their tenant.

While some of the tenants fail to convey the arrival of property tax notices to the owners, residents said that they fail to pay the taxes within the half-yearly fiscal of a financial year.

“Instead of sending the notices through a letter to property owners, why not send SMS text or messages on other platforms to convey the property tax dues? It will also help the civic body to complete the tax collection target easily,” S Muthukrishnan, a resident of Thillai Nagar said.

In case of property owners forgetting to pay the taxes for the half-yearly fiscals, the arrear amount adds on to the next half-yearly fiscal, which makes the property owners feel like they are shelling out a huge sum on property tax.

As the mobile numbers of the property owners are already available with the corporation, sources said that linking the mobile numbers with property tax assessment is easy for sending the tax due notices. “There was such a plan to send text messages for intimating the tax dues. The decision has to be taken by state-level officials, we will convey the demand,” an official with the corporation said.

Title: Margao carnival parade proceeds on new route
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

The Margao carnival float parade proceeded on the new route in Fatorda and not through the old route through M... Read More

PANAJI: Thounsands attended the Margao carnival float parade that proceeded on the new route in Fatorda on Sunday evening. Earlier in the day, the Margao Carnival Committee, which had sought to revert it to the old route through Margao town, did not get any relief from the court.

The high court on Sunday morning heard a petition by the committee but refused to grant it relief and refused to stay its own order passed on Friday. The court will hear the application made by the Carnival committee on Monday.

In its application before the court, the committee through its chairperson Arthur D’Silva stated that Resolution 4934 taken on January 15 based on which the high court passed its order on Friday was fabricated and doctored.

The committee submitted to the high court that the resolution was fraudulently drawn where there was no confirmation of the minutes. There was no question of any resolution being passed as 12 councilors were in favour of the parade being held on the old route, a proven majority in the meeting attended by 23 councillors in favour of the route. The question of a decision passed unanimously doesn’t arise, the committee stated in its application.

The committee alleged that the council was aware of this and hence no meeting was called from January 15 to February 22 to confirm the resolution. It added that 12 councillors have filed complaints with the collector about the alleged fabricated and doctored resolution dated January 15 which was tendered before the high court.

The high court on Friday, hearing a petition by Fatorda resident Custodio Dias, had restrained the South Goa collector, director of tourism, superintendent and deputy superintendent of police from entertaining any applications for the finalisation of the Carnival route from the chairperson of the Carnival committee.

The court on Friday noted that the Carnival committee which sought permissions to have the float parade through Margao couldn’t go against the resolution of the Margao Municipal Council which “unanimously resolved to hold the parade along the route from Old Market Colva circle to Lake Plaza at Fatorda” at its ordinary meeting on January 15, 2020.

South Goa collector had cited public safety as a reason for finalising the Fatorda route for the parade.

Title: Vigil increased after question paper goes viral
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: Jalna police will keep a check on malpractices and unethical practices during the Higher Secondary School Certificate (HSC) examinations.

This decision was taken by the Jalna superintendent of police Siriprolu Chaitanya. This comes after the Hindi question paper of the ongoing HSC exams went viral through Whatsapp on Saturday.

The Hindi question paper was leaked from an examination centre in Partur, Jalna. An offence was registered with the Partur police on Saturday against eight suspects.

The malpractice came to the notice of probationary IPS officer Nilesh Tambe and his team, who went to the photocopy centre and found the suspect with photocopies of the question paper.

According to the police, the photocopy centre belongs to a teacher in Lal Bahadur Shastri College, Partur, and he had leaked the question paper over WhatsApp to his accomplice at the photocopy centre.

This was happening when the Hindi exam was underway at Lal Bahadur Shastri College, Partur.

The matter was brought to the notice of the education department officials, who assisted the police in the panchanama process.

Tambe told TOI, “We have registered offence against the eight suspects under relevant sections of Maharashtra Prevention of Malpractices at Universities, Board and other specified Examinations Act 1982. In addition to this, section 188 of IPC has also been included.”

On February 18, the MIDC Waluj police station of Aurangabad had caught five teachers including centre head while they were writing answers for the English paper.

Sources in the police informed that following the incident, police officials have asked the police personnel deployed at the examination centres to keep a close watch on the activities.

Title: Save education panel urges guv to intervene
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

T’puram: Save Education Campaign Committee has urged state governor Arif Mohammed Khan to give directions to universities to follow a uniform recruitment procedure lest the reservation norms are flouted.

Different and contradictory procedures followed by state universities for the recruitment of faculties could torpedo reservation norms and hence the request for intervention into the matter, the committee said in a petition submitted to the governor who is also the chancellor of the universities.

Calicut University issued notifications inviting applications to fill teaching posts in various subjects without showing the reservation turn, in compliance with the judgement of the Kerala high court. In the verdict, the HC directed not to earmark reservation in the notification and to recruit candidates as per the roster following Kerala State and Subordinate Services Rules (KS&SSR) and reservation shall be looked at the time appointments.

Contrary to this HC judgement, Kerala University and Cusat issued notifications for the selection of teaching posts specifying communal reservations as done earlier. Statutes of all universities clearly stipulate that in making appointment for all posts as determined by the syndicate in any service, class or category under the university, the university shall mutatis mutandis observe the provisions of clause (a), (b) & (c) of Rule 14 and the provisions of Rule 15, 16, 17 and 17A of KS&SSR - 1958 as amended from time to time. Hence the selection process of teaching faculties of all universities in the state should follow a uniform procedure.

The present selection process is adopting contrasting notifications and selection procedure by individual universities in the state, said the petition, was in violation of the specific clauses of KS&SSR and are aimed at giving appointing authorities a freehand to manipulate communal reservation.

Title: Minister mulls digging open trenches in forests areas adjoining farms
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Digging trenches in forest areas will be in violation of Forest Conservation Act (FCA) 1980 & Indian Forest Ac... Read More

Nagpur: The idea of forest minister Sanjay Rathod to dig deep trenches near farms alongside forest areas in the state has not gone down well with senior officials.

Rathod has called a meeting in Mumbai on Monday in which digging of deep trenches in forests on farm boundaries to save farmers’ crop by wildlife near forest areas is one of the top issues.

Officials are wary of forest minister’s wayward idea. “Such open trenches will not only cause animal and human deaths, it would also be in violation of Forest Conservation Act (FCA) 1980 and Indian Forest Act (IFA) 1927 as the areas that will be dug will be forest. In no case farmers will allow to dig their land,” they said.

“There is no feasibility report called or technicalities examined before taking up such a project which will immensely burden the public exchequer by crores of rupees,” they said.

“Nowhere such a project has been successful. On the contrary digging of deep trenches in forest may lead to flash flood into farmers’ field. The deep trenches act as resting place for wild animals which may add to the agony of the adjoining cultivators. In all probabilities, such structures not only result in loss of forest boundary but also convert into deep gullies causing further erosion of fertile soil. The idea is to use funds under Compensatory Afforestation Fund Management & Planning Authority (CAMPA),” said sources.

However, the issues for which CAMPA funds will be sought doesn’t even find place in annual plan of operations (APO) of CAMPA. Officials agreed that such trenches are dug in forest areas but that is done as per approved working plans by the MoEFCC to protect plantations and mark forest boundaries.

Minister Rathod did not respond to TOI calls. Sources close to him said, “This is just an idea and not a proposal. The issue will be discussed in the meeting and final decision will be taken after that.”

With the onset of assembly session from Monday, minister has called not less than 15 senior forest officials to Mumbai for a meeting to discuss various issues which include development of Tipeshwar sanctuary, relocation of villages in Painganga and Dnyanganga sanctuaries, besides appointments of forest patils on the lines of police patils. Of the six issues that will come up for discussions in Monday’s meeting, four pertain to minister’s home district Yavatmal.

Can a cash-strapped government afford to call 15 top officials who will fly to Mumbai to attend the meeting? All the senior officials will fly to Mumbai on Monday to attend the meeting at 2pm.

“When facilities like videoconferencing are available, why waste time and huge money on air fare and other logistics?” asked a section of officials.

Title: 2-day mandolin concert from today at Patto
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Panaji: Mandolin players from various parts of the country will perform in Goa at the fourth edition of the Mandolin fest of India which is being held from February 24 to 25.

The mandolin festival has traveled to Pune, Kolhapur and Bengaluru ever since its inception in 2017. This year, the festival is being held at Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, from 9.30 am to 7pm on both days.

There will be 50 individual musicians performing back to back on day one of the event. A group of about 15 girls from Maharashtra’s Varna village will also perform at the event.

“The instrument found its way from Italy into India through Goa. We have therefore invited two talented artistes from Italy – Maestros Carlo Aonzo (mandolin) and Lorenzo Bernardi (guitar) – to participate in the festival,” said festival director, Pradipto Sengupta.

The duo will perform on day two of the festival. The two-day festival will be free of cost for the audience.

“We want this festival to be so successful that mandolin performers are able represent India internationally,” said organiser, Anil Pendse.

Title: Pune: Dentist loses Rs 60,000 to online fraud over job opportunity
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Two fraudsters duped a 33-year-old dentist of Rs 60,000 after promising her a job. On February 19, the due asked the woman to transfer the money online under the pretext of registration charges and duped her.

The woman approached the Sangvi police station on Friday and lodged an FIR. The police have registered an offence under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and the IT Act.

Assistant inspector Dattatreya Guling of the Sangvi police station said that the complainant is the dentist and runs a clinic in Moshi. On Wednesday, she received a call from a woman, who introduced her as an the executive of an online job placement portal. “The woman offered a job opportunity to the dentist and told her to fill a form. She also told the dentist to pay an initial amount,” Guling said.

He added that the doctor made an online transfer to an account number sent to her. “The woman transferred Rs60,000 for registration and other charges,” Guling said. The dentist turned suspicious when the woman sought more money. “The probe revealed that the amount was transferred to a bank account in Bengaluru,” the officer said.

Title: Review of liquor ban: Ex-min playing wait and watch game
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Chandrapur: Former minister Sudhir Mungantiwar, who played a key role in clamping liquor prohibition in Chandrapur, is playing the wait and watch game after guardian minister Vijay Wadettiwar instituted a committee to review the previous government’s decision. The committee’s report is expected in the first week of March.

“If the government revokes the liquor ban in Chandrapur then the same should be done in the other dry districts —Wardha and Gadchiroli. It they say that there’s loss of revenue or sale of illegal liquor is rampant in Chandrapur then it is same for Wardha and Gadchiroli as well,”said Mungantiwar.

Amid rising difference between Congress-NCP and Shiv Sena over implementation of the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Population Register (NPR), Mungantiwar added fuel to the fire by saying that the BJP’s doors are always open for the party headed by chief minister Uddhav Thackeray to form a government if the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government collapses.

Mungantiwar claimed that the Shiv Sena is a natural ally on the contentious issue. “If the Shiv Sena is feeling suffocated, it can return to the BJP to form the government in Maharashtra. We are ready to join hands with them,” said Mungantiwar during his interaction with the media.

On the issue of chief ministership, Mungantiwar said it’s a non-issue and can be sorted out through a mature dialogue between leaders of both the saffron parties.

Title: Trichy achieves ease of living feedback target but ranks 5th
Content:
A week left for the deadline to submit citizen perception feedback for the ease of living 2019 exercise, Tric... Read More

Trichy: A week left for the deadline to submit citizen perception feedback for the ease of living 2019 exercise, Trichy has already achieved the number of feedback target to be submitted online.Considering the quality of life, sustainability and economic ability as three main pillars, the ministry of housing and urban affairs (MoHUA) since 2018 is conducting an exercise to rank Indian cities based on livability conditions. Subsequently for the year 2019, MoHUA launched ease of living survey from February 1, 2020, inviting citizens to submit the perception about their city on the official ease of living website. Including Trichy, 12 Tamil Nadu cities will be competing in the survey for which the urban local bodies here ought to furnish a set of data sought such as the number of hospital beds available in the city and crime reported against women. Besides, residents of the respective cities should submit their perception about the city. With each city given a target to achieve submitting feedback, all Tamil Nadu cities except Chennai has completed its targets.Though Trichy has achieved the target, the city is placed 5th among the 12 Tamil Nadu cities and overall in 18th spot based on the number of citizen perception feedback given as on February 23, 2020. Salem, Madurai and Erode were the top three Tamil Nadu cities.“Till February 29, we can submit the citizen perception feedback. Residents will be encouraged more to participate in the exercise,” an official source with Trichy corporation said.

Title: Bamu’s Tushar Aher wins gold medal in Khelo India University Games
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Tushar Aher

AURANGABAD: Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University ( BAMU ) student Tushar Aher won the gold medal in Fencing during the inaugural edition of the Khelo India University Games (KIYG) in Bhubaneswar, Odisha on Sunday.

Tushar won all the qualifying matches and was at the top of the points table. In the elimination round, he defeated Amit A from Chandigarh University to reach the semi-final. During the semi-final round, Tushar clashed with Shivaji University’s Vipul Yadekar to reach the last two. In the final, he was pitched against Tariq Hussain from Guru Nanak Dev University, Amritsar in the final where he won the nail-biting encounter to seal the gold medal.

Tushar, who in past has won a state-level award for excellence in Fencing, has been congratulated by Bamu vice-chancellor Pramod Yeole for emerging victorious at the national level. “It is a moment of pride and happiness that our university student has demonstrated excellence at the national level,” he said.

Uday Dongare, Pandurang Ranmal, Dinesh Wanjare, and Suhas Yadav were among the coaching staff who trained Tushar for the games.

The first edition of KIYG saw as many as 3,400 athletes from 159 universities across the country vying for top honours across 17 disciplines.

Title: Maharashtra: Hunt on for tour operator wanted for duping elderly
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: The Deccan Gymkhana police are on the trail of a tour operator evading arrest for almost three months after a group of 28 senior citizens first lodged an FIR against him for cheating them by not delivering on the promised services during a trip to Kullu Manali in Himachal Pradesh in August 2018.

The senior citizens found themselves in the lurch when they realized on reaching Himachal Pradesh that the operator did not make any hotel booking. Later, he kept promising them about returning money for the undelivered service, but to no avail. He has since changed office from the JM Road to a shopping complex on FC road.

On February 13, another group of 23 senior citizens lodged a second FIR accusing him of cheating them of Rs5.28 lakh over a tour of Andaman and Nicobar islands which was promised in January 2018, but never materialized.

Now, another group of 20 people has approached the police with a complaint against the elusive operator for cheating them of Rs5 lakh over a tour of seven northeastern states.

Most of the victims in all the three instances are from Pune, Satara, Ratnagiri and adjoining districts, the police said.

Senior police inspector Deepak Lagad told TOI, “The operator has changed his residence on multiple occasions over the past three months and has gone incommunicado. He has not opened his office either.”

The TOI on Sunday tried to contact the tour operator by making calls on his cell phonenumber, but it was on a switched off mode. A text message sent on his cellphone evoked no response. A visit to the last-known location of his office at Sagar Arcade on FC road revealed that he had vacated the premises six months ago and a cybersecurity firm now operates from the premises. At the Bhosale-Shinde Arcade on the JM road, where his earlier office was located, the shopkeepers said he had left the premises long time ago.

Lagad said, “The tour operator would give small advertisements in newspapers attracting people for tours to various destinations. He would quote minimum cost of tour for drawing people to his office and accept money from them. But he would not book either their tickets or hotel rooms.”

Referring to the first FIR lodged on December 3, 2019, Lagad said, “The tour operator had taken Rs40,000 from each of the 28 members, mostly senior citizens, for the Kullu-Manali trip. He booked their train tickets, but did not the hotel rooms and the bus for the local commute. When the irate tourists on their return went to his office and demanded a refund, he handed over amounts in the range of Rs5,000 to Rs8000 to each one of them.”

The second FIR was lodged on February 13 by a 71-year-old victim, who said the tour operator collected Rs32,000 from each of the 23 people who were to go for the Andaman and Nicobar trip in January 2018. The amount included charges for air tickets, hotel rooms and local commute, but the tour never took off. “When people demanded a refund, the tour operator returned Rs8,000 to each of them. Despite repeated requests by the people, he did not return the remaining Rs24,000 to each of them,” the FIR stated.

Lagad said, “We are verifying details of the latest complaint application by the group of 20 persons before taking a call on registration of a FIR.”

Title: Lucknow: ‘Need easy Hindi words to teach science’
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

LUCKNOW: There is a need to coin easy Hindi words for English scientific terms to strengthen science writings in Hindi, said experts at Bharatiya Bhasha Mahotsav held at Lucknow University on Sunday. “Universities should find out simple Hindi words for tough scientific terms or should coin new words for them to strengthen scientific writing in the language. These Hindi words should be then popularized among masses,” said Prof Bhumitra Dev, an academician.

Quoting the example of Hans Selye, who coined the word ‘stress’ in 1936 for a medical condition of the General Adaptation Syndrome, Prof Dev said, “As ‘stress’ was as an easy word, it was quickly adopted and widely accepted. There is a similar need for coining such easy to understand words to promote science writing in Hindi,” he added. V P Sharma, a scientist from Indian Institute of Toxicology Research , said for writing science in simple language, its necessary to understand the same in the simplest form.

For explaining scientific concepts easily in Hindi, stress should be on giving examples from everyday life Like for teaching fermentation process, one should be given example of how ‘jalebi’ (sweet) is cooked, he added.

Title: ESG looking to demolish building: Digambar Kamat
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Digambar Kamat

PANAJI: Leader of the opposition Digambar Kamat has criticised the decision to undertake renovation of the Inox multiplex building, demanding chief minister Pramod Sawant’s intervention. “After demolishing the Goan film industry since 2012, ESG is now on a demolition drive of the multiplex at Campal to create a new structure. The government should first release a white-paper on the actual benefits of Iffi for Goa and performance of ESG vis-a-vis its actual contribution to promote the Goan film fraternity,” Kamat said.

He said that the government is yet to fulfill the promise of building the Iffi convention center, and suddenly this new idea is floated; surely with some ulterior motives.

Reacting to this, vice-chairman of Entertainment society of Goa (ESG), Subhash Phal Desai said, “The existing Inox multiplex building will not be demolished. The same architecture will be retained; the renovation would be of the interiors.”

Kamat also said that local film producers have been deprived of benefits under the film finance scheme. “The scheme which was launched by Congress was kept dormant almost for three years by the BJP government,” he said.

Title: Lucknow: February to end on a stormy note, brace for a wet week
Content:
Representative image

LUCKNOW: The last week of February will begin on a wet note with weathermen forecasting rain, thunderstorm and gale winds on Monday and Tuesday. Partly cloudy skies are expected to bring down the mercury during the day, but night temperatures will witness a rise.A western disturbance over the Himalayas and a cyclonic circulation over Haryana and west UP are responsible for the change in weather conditions. The wind pattern has changed from dry westerlies to moisture-laden easterlies. These easterlies will bring moisture from the Bay of Bengal to the state and the city, Met officials said.The factors together are expected to create conditions conducive to thunder/dust storm and light rainfall in some parts of UP, including Lucknow. The weather systems are expected to fizzle out by Wednesday-Thursday after which the skies will be clear.“There are 50% chances of the city receiving light showers on Monday while on Tuesday, the possibility of intermittent rain during the day is higher,” said state Met director JP Gupta. The maximum temperature on Sunday was 27.6°C, around 0.2 degrees below normal.As clouds did not allow ground heat to escape into the atmosphere, the night was warm with the minimum shooting up to 16.6°C, more than five notches above normal.

Title: Goa: Iron tablets for students from March 1
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: From March 1, pre-primary and primary school students, up to the age of 9, will be provided iron and folic acid supplements. The campaign, part of the national iron plus initiative, aims to help prevent anaemia in children.

In the first phase, the programme will be conducted in Mapusa , Aldona, Porvorim, Chimbel, Panaji , Betki, Corlim and Cortalim.

The scheme has been launched by the Union ministry of health and family welfare in a bid to combat anaemia at different life stages by administering supplement of iron, folic acid and albendazole .

“From March 1 onwards, 1ml Syp iron and folic acid will be administered bi-weekly to those between 6 to 59 months and one pink junior iron and folic acid tablet will be administered once a week to those is the age group of 5 to 9 years,” schools in the state have been instructed.

During the 2018-19 academic year, 2.7 lakh students were provided iron and folic acid supplements.

As per the ministry, the School Health Programme has been introduced to monitor health of school children and provide them with essential nutrients to increase the efficacy of other investments in child development.

Title: Man gored to death in jallikattu
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Madurai: A man was gored to death by a bull during the jallikattu event held in Nallamanayakkanpatti in Thottanoothu panchayat in Dindigul district on Sunday. The victim was identified as Nagaraj, 21, of Vellaputhur near Natham. Though he was rushed to the Dindigul government hospital he succumbed to injuries.

The event in Nallamanayakkanpatti draws in large crowds and the district administration had made all arrangements for conducting the event. It was inaugurated by the Dindigul RDO, Usha, in the presence of other officials.

As many as 273 bull tamers had registered for the game and 267 of them were allowed to participate in it. Nearly 500 bulls were registered for the game. Nagaraj getting hurt resulted in the event coming to a close all of a sudden. Over 150 police personnel were on duty at the venue.

Title: Boy, 4, beaten up by mom’s paramour dies
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Madurai: A four-year-old boy from Tirunelveli was murdered his mother’s paramour because he revealed their extramarital affair to his father. A Lokesh, 4, who was beaten up mercilessly by Sorimuthu, the paramour, on Friday, died in hospital on Sunday not responding to treatment.

The Melapalayam police have picked up the boy’s mother Deepa, 28, for questioning and are searching for her paramour. The police said they were yet to register an FIR, but they are likely to register a case under IPC section 302 – punishment for murder.

Deepa’s husband Antony Prakash, a truck driver, fell in love with Deepa, from Pollachi in Coimbatore district, and married her in 2015. The couple settled in Antony’s native in Vickramansingapuram.

Deepa’s began an extra martial relationship with Sorimuthu, 25, from the same village. The two went to a private lodge in Tirunelveli city when Prakash went away on work. When he came to know that she was not at home, he grew suspicious and asked her to make a video call on Whatsapp. But she did not call him, police said.

The two had locked Lokesh outside the room and earlier Sorimuthu had even slapped the boy. When Antony made a phone call to his wife’s number, the boy picked it up and narrated what was going on at the lodge and how he was treated, police said.

When the two came to know about this, Sorimuthu thrashed the boy, which left him unconscious. They took him to Tirunelveli government medical college hospital and Sorimuthu went into hiding. After the boy died, the police picked up the mother. Police sources said Deepa too will be charged with murder.

Title: Kanpur: Village head certifies death, wishes ‘bright future’ of dead
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Death certificate issued by the village head of Sirwaiya village

KANPUR: In a bizarre incident, the pradhan of a village in Unnao issued a death certificate of an elderly man on his letter head confirming the demise and concluding it by wishing him a ‘bright future’.

The incident came to light when the death certificate issued by the ‘pradhan’ (village head) of Sirwaiya village in Asoha block of Unnao district went viral on social media on Sunday.

According to reports, one Lakshmishankar, an elderly, had died following illness in Sirwaiya on January 22, 2020.

On February 17, the son of the deceased went to the pradhan Babulal and requested him to issue a death certificate he needed to give to some financial institution.

The village head not only issued a death certificate, but also ‘wished’ ‘a bright future of the deceased’ on the document.

The village head concluded the death certificate by stating, “Main inke ujjwal bhavishya ki kaamna karta hoon (I wish him a bright future).”

The photo of the letter issued by the pradhan went viral on social media on Sunday. The village head apologized for the error.

“I apologise for the mistake. A new death certificate will be issued to the son of the deceased,” said Babu Lal.

Title: No private transportation of biomedical waste, asserts MPCB
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Only the common biomedical waste treatment and disposal facilities should be roped in for the job, the board c... Read More

AURANGABAD: The Maharashtra Pollution Control Board ( MPCB ) has strictly asked its sub-divisional offices to not allow private transportation of biomedical waste generated from health establishments.

The assertion has come from MPCB in the wake of regional offices forwarding the biomedical waste application to private transporters.

Only the common biomedical waste treatment and disposal facilities should be roped in for the job, the board clarified.

“It was noticed that sub-regional offices are forwarding the biomedical waste transportation application to private transporter from the health care establishments. As per the revised guidelines of the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB), the grant of authorisation for collection and transportation of biomedical waste by transporter other than the common biomedical waste treatment and disposal facilities is prohibited. The board has taken a policy decision to not authorise any private biomedical water transporter,” MPCB member secretary E Ravindran has said.

Ravindran has also asked the divisional authorities to instruct the local body and the district collector to initiate suitable legal action against the hospitals and illegal private transporter in case of any violations.

Health officer with the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation, Nita Padalkar said no violation of the MPCB norm came to her notice in Aurangabad. “We have appointed a common biomedical waste treatment and disposal facilities. All the city hospitals are registered with the facility and no private transportation of the biomedical waste collection has come to our notice,” she said.

Satyanarayan Somani, president of the Indian Medical Association (IMA), Aurangabad chapter, said no private transportation of biomedical waste was taking place in the city. “Even if small hospitals have certain complaints with the service of the common biomedical waste treatment and disposal facilities, no private player is still in place in the city. The private contractor appointed as a part of the common biomedical waste treatment and disposal facility does not pay regular visits to small hospitals,” he said.
