Title: Man arrested for attacking woman in north Delhi park
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: A 22-year-old man has been arrested for smashing a rock on the head of a woman. The woman was found unconscious in Bonta Park in north Delhi on Saturday. The man had also slashed a razor across his wrist after going back home.

Police said that the accused, Bilal, had attacked the woman as he was jealous that she was friendly with another man. Bilal had befriended the woman on Facebook. On one occasion he introduced her to another friend of his, Imran.

“Bilal started getting jealous as she started talking to Imran more than him. The two met at Bonta Park and Bilal saw Imran’s messages to her on her phone, which angered him,” said a police officer. When the woman snatched her phone back, the accused tried to strangle her, failing which he picked up a stone and hit her on her head multiple times. A passerby informed the cops about a woman lying unconscious in a park. Police said that she has gained consciousness now.

Bilal, a resident of Loni, returned to his house and slit his wrist. He was taken to a hospital by his family. He also suffers from polio. Police later arrested him from his house.

Title: IUML protest only to attack CM: Kareem
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Kozhikode: Shaheen Bagh model agitations being staged by IUML leader M K Muneer is an insult to the original Shaheen Bagh protest in Delhi, said CPM leader Elamaram Kareem , MP.

Inaugurating the protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ) organized by the SFI and the DYFI here on Sunday, he said the IUML platform is used only to heap slurs on chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan.

The anti-CAA protests are the movement of all sections of the people in the country, especially the youth and students. By joining hands, the ruling party and opposition in Kerala showed the way to the whole country on staging protests against the CAA, Kareem said.

“But later, KPCC president said his party is not for joint agitation. Some political parties are threatening social organizations that have come forward for joint protests and certain communal organizations are trying to conduct separate agitations,” he added.

Such divisive moves will weaken the struggle that is based on secularism, Kareem said. “This will be beneficial for the RSS,” he said.

In her address, Aishe Ghosh, student of Jawaharlal Nehru University and the leader of the agitations in Delhi, said Kerala is an inspiration for the protests in other parts of the country.

“The government is unleashing a war against the students who are staging protests,” she said.

DYFI national president P A Muhammad Riyas, state secretary A A Raheem, CPM district secretary P Mohanan, Abhishek Nandan, student leader of the University of Hyderabad, Mehfoos Alam of Jamia Milia Islamia, Pavan Kumar from Gujarat University, SFI state secretary Sachindev, SYS state executive member Abdul Majeed Ariyallur, Wisdom Youth general secretary Thajudeen Swalahi, ISM general secretary Anwar Sadath and others addressed the gathering.

Title: Students demand toilets at Nagpur University exam section
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Nationalist Youth Congress met vice-chancellor SP Kane recently to apprise him of the problem

NAGPUR: Students, especially those coming from outside the city, have demanded toilet facility at Nagpur University exam section , where they have to spend several hours for their work during their visits.

The students and other visitors have been suffering at the section since July 31, 2017, when NU started a new facilitation centre at the entrance of the exam section. The centre has blocked the way to the existing toilets inside the exam section.

The entry was restricted even at the facilitation centre, with officials making it mandatory for all to give a ‘plausible reason’ for the visit before allowing them inside. Even those having work at the centre are not allowed in, unless they are carrying supporting documents for their work. The centre is run by private agency Promarc, and the space has been provided by NU to it at no cost, said students.

The restricted entry to the section has left students and even other visitors badly inconvenienced. As NU has affiliated colleges from as far as Wardha, Gondia and Bhandara, the exam section is a hotspot for daylong activity of visitors.

The section is located on LIT campus with plenty of open spaces on all its sides. While men have been relieving themselves in the open, women have no choice but to go out, said Nationalist Youth Congress ’s (NYC) Rahul Kamble, who led the students delegation to vice chancellor SP Kane last week.

Kamble said Kane assured to start construction of a new toilet on the open land in front of the exam section. “They have asked for one month. We will wait and then intensify our protest if the demand is not met,” he said.

Kamble said earlier people were allowed to use the toilets inside but that is no longer available.

Title: Nagpur: IMA Maharashtra rubbishes NGO survey that ‘defamed doctors’
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: A study conducted by a Pune NGO that had many controversial conclusions about behaviour of doctors and pharma companies had created waves in December 2019. Indian Medical Association (IMA) had termed it defamatory.

Now, IMA Maharashtra president Dr Avinash Bhondwe, who hails from Pune, has claimed that the Maharashtra branch of IMA investigated this survey along with Maharashtra medical council (MMC) and found that the survey was not only unscientific but also fake.

“As the survey came from Maharashtra, the IMA state body decided to investigate it. We approached NGO ‘Sathi’ and asked them details about their research methodology and claims. Earlier, they were reluctant to share information. Later, they admitted they didn’t have enough details to support their claims,” said Dr Bhondwe while speaking to TOI on his maiden visit to Nagpur after becoming president of Maharashtra IMA.

“In a meeting with IMA officials, NGO representatives issued unconditional apology to us. Later, we demanded it in written form and they also issued a ‘clarification’ and not apology. We have that letter in our possession,” Dr Bhondwe claimed.

IMA Maharashtra’s internal publication, which is going to be released in March, will have all details of this case for the reference of doctors across the country, he added.

Dr Bhondwe was in the city to attend a state-level workshop on PC & PNDT Act at IMA Hall. He said that people level serious allegations on doctors these days. “It has become easy to level allegations and get away these days. We have strategically decided to deal with such allegations seriously now,” he said, adding that at least two political leaders have issued public apologies after IMA approached them regarding and proved that their allegations were false.

Dr Arun Gadre from NGO Sathi accepted that he has given a clarification to IMA. “I issued clarification to IMA that since study was qualitative, no names were asked and not any name was given. Trends were asked for and report contains categories of trend in the field,” he said.

Title: Agra: Errors galore on hoardings placed to welcome Trump
Content:
The message written in Hindi has a mistake in the word 'Bemisal'.

AGRA: Ahead of US President Donald Trump's visit to Agra, errors surfaced on the hoarding placed on the VVIP route from Kheria airbase to the Taj Mahal.A hoarding featuring Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Trump placed in front of Hotel Amar on Fatehabad road reads 'Do Mahan Desh, Ek Bemisal Dosti' (two great nations, one matchless friendship). The message written in Hindi has a mistake in the word 'Bemisal'.Another hoarding placed by Agra Municipal Corporation (AMC) has a spelling mistake and it has gone viral on social media on Sunday evening. The hoarding in front of Hotel Mansingh Palace on Fatehabad road reads 'Kuda kachra ab nahi bachega, kyonki wo aa raha hai apkey shehr' (garbage will not remain, because he is coming to your city).A shopkeeper on Fatehabad road said, "The message is completely absurd and should be immediately removed as it disrespects the state guest. Besides, the word 'kyonki' has been spelled wrong."When asked about the mistakes on the posters, district magistrate PN Singh said, "The error in the uni-pole hoarding has been identified and it is being removed. I am not aware of the hoarding placed by the civic body; it will also be removed."

Title: Dr Fazal, a renowned doctor and philanthropist, passes away
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Nagpur: One of the senior most medical practitioners of the region and a dedicated philanthropist, Dr Fazal , passed away on Monday morning after a brief illness. He was 95. He was a resident of Mahdi Bagh colony.

A former civil surgeon in Madhya Pradesh, Dr Fazal had been practicing in the city for around 50 years. He was the grandfather of international cricketer and Vidarbha captain Faiz Fazal. He is survived behind his wife, two sons, a daughter, grandchildren, great grandchildren and innumerable friends and admirers.

He was a senior vice president of Indian Medical Association and was closely associated with several leading medical bodies. During his 72 years of practice, Dr Fazal served five generations of people across India. He was a dedicated philanthropist and known as the ‘people’s doctor’ in local circles for not only waiving his fees but also providing free medicines to hundreds of needy patients.

In his 22-year stint in villages of India, he performed unusual medical feats such as removing a 70-pound ovarian tumour, a record number of hysterectomies, resection of intestine and anastomosis, including peptic ulcer surgeries without regular anaesthetist, and removing 18 fibroids from the uterus of a 27-year-old woman who later conceived because hysterectomy was avoided. He performed surgeries of all sorts even at the age of 95.

A man of many skills and uncommon grit, Dr Fazal played cricket and golf even at the age of 90. A deeply spiritual person, he spent his free time translating and typing religious texts from Arabic and Urdu for the sake of the younger generation in his Mahdi Bagh colony. At the age of 92, he braved the odds and undertook pilgrimages to remote and strife-torn areas. He was conferred with very high spiritual honours by three successive generations of spiritual masters who had great admiration and respect for his services.

A lover of poetry, music and literature, he was a regular at poetry sessions and qawaalis in and around Nagpur. He had also acquired remarkable IT skills in his nineties.

The medical, literary and social circles of Nagpur expressed deep sorrow on his passing away.

Title: Nagpur: ‘Kisht Bahar’depicts situation in Jammu and Kashmir after end of special status
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Kisht Bahar a play What Tanmay Group during 59th Maharashtra Rajya Hindi Natya Spardha organised by the States... Read More

NAGPUR: Reality in Jammu and Kashmir after abrogation of Article 370 that ended the special status it enjoyed was effectively portrayed in Hindi play titled ‘Kisht Bahar’, staged by Tanmayee Bahuddeshiya Shikshan Sanstha at Scientific Society Hall, on Friday.

The story revolves around the family of Bhatt, living in Kishtwar region, with wife Sandhya, daughter Aashu and son Sanjeet.

Written by Salim Sheikh, the story highlights the incidents of terrorist groups circulating fake news on social media of how people of the country were talking rubbish about girls and women in Kashmir and making them believe that what they saw was real. These anti-national elements provoked youngsters and forced them to join terror activities.

The play mentioned Article 370, troops deployed by the government, and terrorists talking of freeing Kashmir for which they incite people in the valley.

Aashu (Ayesha Sheikh) gets injured in stone pelting by divisive forces, but soldiers of the Indian Army ensure she get timely medical treatment. Her brother Sanjeet (Aadesh Jamnik) was one of the stone pelters indulging in unlawful activities.

Sanjeet later comes in contact with Gilani (Parikshit Harsole), a respected politician in the region. Sanjeet did not know that he was the mastermind behind many terror attacks. Gilani provokes youngsters to take part in the fight for freedom to Kashmir.

One day, a soldier comes to the residence of Bhatt (Salim Sheikh) to enquire about the health of Aashu where he finds Sanjeet’s actions suspicious. Investigations reveal the stone pelters were hiding at a place. When Army officials go there, they find a known political leader Gilani and return without carrying out search operations.

The soldier again goes to the residence of Bhatt, looking for Sanjeet. But his mother Sandhya (Sanyukta Thorat) lies that he is studying in his room though she knew that he was roaming around.

As curfew is imposed to rein in ultras, people have to stay indoors for days together. It was during this time Sandhya realizes that her son was involved in terrorist activities. She cries and tells her husband that Sanjeet had made a terrible mistake.

After some days, Aashu and Sandhya go to a hospital though curfew was in place. On their return, Bhatt finds that his daughter’s vision is lost forever. He is shattered to know Anshu has become blind.

Sanjeet then finds that it was the handiwork of the terror group he was associated with that made his sister blind. He realizes his mistake of indulging in nefarious acts and returns to the family.

Director and actors did justice to the theme of the play.

(Reporting by Rushabh Rathod)

Title: Shaheen Bagh way: Women take lead again
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

By Sunday morning, nearly a thousand people, according to some estimates, had gathered at the Jafrabad protest... Read More

NEW DELHI: Replicating the Shaheen Bagh model, women again took the lead in the protest against Citizenship Amendment Act in northeast Delhi’s Jafrabad that started late on Saturday and continued through Sunday.

While the women had already been agitating for over a month, it was only over the weekend that they resorted to blocking the road. Some women TOI spoke to said their movement had got a boost after Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad came out in their support and exhorted them to join a Bharat Bandh call given by him.

One of the women claimed that since no one from the government had bothered to come forward for a dialogue on the issue, they had chosen to go the Shaheen Bagh way and blocked the road. “Har jagah Shaheen Bagh banaenge,” she said.

Around 11pm, some 500 women gathered under Jafrabad Metro station Gate No. 1 and squatted on the road. Police arrived soon and asked them to disperse, but in less than an hour, more people, including men and children, joined in.

Even as paramilitary forces were deployed, the numbers kept swelling and, by Sunday morning, nearly a thousand people, according to some estimates, had gathered.

The scene was similar to Shaheen Bagh in more ways than one: as dadis of the crowd mobilised opinion against CAA, some locals took upon themselves to distribute tea, fruits and other eatables for free. The protesters set up tables and tied them together to make a stage, but it was eventually removed by police.

Farheen Firoz, an MA student, told TOI: “For over two months now, people have been sitting at Shaheen Bagh and even Seelampur. We are here to show solidarity with them. We want the government to hear us out. The home minister and the Prime Minister are saying different things ... how do we know what to believe? This is not a fight for Muslims, it is a fight for secularism.”

Close by, some people raised a banner that read “February 23 Bharat bandh ko safal karein”. Some women offered “namaz” in one corner, while others walked past waving the Tricolor. “We support our Dalit brothers ... We are also against CAA and NRC. For 45 days, we have protested peacefully. But no one listened to us. We need a Shaheen Bagh at every corner, so that the government knows our pain,” Nazia, a resident of Seelampur, said.

Barely a few metres from the metro station, there was another island of protesters. They, too, raised anti-CAA slogans. With the passage of time, though, the crowed thinned out.

Title: Donald Trump to meet Indian CEOs creating manufacturing jobs in US
Content:
US President Donald Trump (File photo)

NEW DELHI: US President Donald Trump will meet a select group of about a dozen Indian CEOs on Tuesday and among them will be those whose companies have made investments in the manufacturing sector to create jobs in America.Sources said US Ambassador Kenneth Juster will be hosting the CEOs in the closely guarded meeting with the US President. “The focus is on those companies who have created jobs in the US,” said a source without elaborating.Anand Mahindra, chairman of the Mahindra group, Baba Kalyani , managing director of Bharat Forge, founder and co-chairman of Jubilant group, and Tata Sons chairman N Chandrasekaran are among the 12 CEOs who have got the coveted invite for the meeting. Mukesh Ambani , chairman and managing director of Reliance Industries will also be present in the meeting.Anand Mahindra’s company has made substantial investments in the US and has promised to invest $1 billion apart from the $1 billion that has already been invested in the country. Mahindra unveiled a new office in Washington last year and his company is present in various segments such as automotive manufacturing, farm equipment production, IT services, sustainable transportation and others. Last year, Mahindra had vowed his firm’s commitment to creating jobs in the US as well as taking part in contributing to the development of local economies.Last year, Baba Kalyani’s firm Bharat Forge had announced plans to invest $56 million to set up a new plant in the US. The new forging and machining unit by the world’s largest forging firm will be based in North Carolina. The investment is part of the firm’s plans to raise its presence in lightweight materials such as Aluminium.Similarly, Hari Bhartia’s Jubilant Bhartia group has its presence in the US and Canada. Bhartia has been a key link in the strengthening of US-India economic ties and has led delegations to the US on crucial economic and trade issues.The Tata group is present across sectors in the US and its arm TCS has several large US clients and is based in several key US cities.Since taking over as president, Trump’s focus has been on creating domestic jobs under his America First policy. This has paid off to some extent with several top companies unveiling major investments to set up manufacturing facilities in the US.

Title: Habit of driving with licence picks up in Vizag, say police
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Visakhapatnam: In good news for the city’s road safety situation, the incidence of motorists being caught driving without valid licences have come down. Recent data indicate that only five to eight per cent of those caught for violation of traffic rules were not carrying their driving licenses.

This, according to the police, is a major drop from earlier when 15-20% of all traffic violators were caught without their driving licences. Police sources say that most of those caught without driving licences are college students. Police claim that instances of people driving without licences have come down significantly over the last one year.

Over 3,000 motorists get held up for checks in a day in the city. Police either issue challans to them or enquire about their pending challans. During such routine checks, police have found that only 5-8% of violators are driving without licence .

Interestingly, the percentage comes down further among those held for driving under the influence of alcohol. Only 1-2% of those who were held up for driving under the influence were not carrying driving licences, informed ACP (traffic) MRK Raju.

Meanwhile, traffic police inspector T Raju said that driving licenses have also been suspended in some cases where motorists have been found driving under the influence, beyond speed-limits or have not renewed their licences.

Road Transport Authority (RTA) officials have suspended nearly 500 driving licenses in the last month in Visakhapatnam. Most common traffic violations are driving under the influence of alcohol, which comprises nearly 50% of all violations, rash driving, driving while speaking on the phone.

The recent Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act proposes to increase the fine from Rs 1,000 to Rs 5,000 for driving without a valid licence. A senior police officer said, “We are planning to increase drives against people driving without licences. It’s mostly college students on bikes who are doing this.”

Title: Andhra University joins race for innovation hub
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Andhra University is in the race to get a Technology Innovation Hub under the National Mission on Interdisciplinary Cyber Physical Systems (NM-ICPS). The varsity has sent proposals to the tune of Rs 115 crore for the hub under the theme ‘Technologies for Internet of Things and Everything’, which also involves artificial intelligence and machine learning. The varsity also submitted data and details pertaining to its industry partners, international collaborations, startup ecosystem, research and development infrastructure and etc to the Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB) as part of the application process for the hub.

According to SERB norms, the host institutes of the hubs should be ranked below 50 in the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) and be a reputed academic and R&D institution.

While the varsity stood 29th in the overall institutions category in the NIRF 2019 ranking, it bagged 16th rank among all the Indian universities. On the other hand, the varsity has sent research proposals worth crores to the department of science and technology, Indian Council of Social Science Research, naval research board and other bodies overseeing research activities.

According to the AU officials, the varsity’s notification for recruitment of 40 post-doctoral fellows has drawn nearly 350 applications. “Officials from the University Grants Commission (UGC) and the varsity will jointly conduct the interviews, which will be video-recorded, in March and April months. The varsity has got Rs 100 crore under the RUSA scheme. Apart from other developmental activities, the varsity has proposed to take 100 post-doctoral fellows and 200-300 PhD students with a focus on improving research. Each post-doctoral fellow will get about Rs 1 lakh monthly stipend,” said a varsity official.

Andhra University has already floated a special purpose vehicle — AU RISE — to utilise the Rs 100 crore RUSA grant. While 85% of the grants will be spent on infrastructure, research and faculty improvement, 15% funds will be earmarked for entrepreneurship, innovation and employability. The other initiatives proposed with the RUSA funds are an international MBA programme, collaborations with premier national institutions like IITs and central universities, minor research projects for faculty members with a cap of Rs 10-20 lakh.

Title: Israel strikes Gaza, Syria after Palestinian rockets attacks
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Flame and smoke are seen during Israeli air strikes in the southern Gaza Strip. (Reuters)

JERUSALEM: The Israel military said early Monday that it struck Palestinian militants targets in Gaza and Syria in response to rockets fired toward southern Israel on Sunday evening, hours after Israel said it killed a Palestinian militant who tried to place a bomb along the Israel-Gaza barrier fence.

The Palestinian Islamic Jihad militant group claimed responsibility for the rocket barrages. Palestinians were furious over the image of the man's lifeless body dangling off the front of an Israeli bulldozer that crossed into Gaza to retrieve it. There was also criticism in Gaza of the territory's Hamas rulers for not responding.

The Israeli military reported air raid sirens throughout southern Israel and said at least 20 rockets had been fired. There were no reports of damage or injuries on the Israeli side, but it was the heaviest barrage of rockets from the Gaza Strip in several months. Air raid sirens continued into the evening, and Israel's Home Front Command ordered the suspension of classes in Israeli schools in southern Israeli communities near the Gaza Strip on Monday and prohibited large gatherings.

In response to the rocket fire, the Israeli military said aircraft struck ``dozens of Islamic Jihad terror targets throughout the Gaza Strip`` and a facility belonging to the militant group outside Damascus .

The Gaza health ministry reported that four Palestinians were treated at the Al-Shifa hospital in Gaza City for wounds caused by the Israeli strikes.

Israel and the Islamic Jihad group engaged in a heavy round of fighting last November after the Israeli military killed a top Islamic Jihad commander.

Since then, Israel and Gaza's more powerful Hamas group have been working through Egyptian mediators to cement an informal cease-fire. But Islamic Jihad has continued to try to carry out attacks.

Islamic Jihad said the man killed along the border was a militant. Israel said the man was planting explosives along the border fence. Amateur video on Palestinian social media showed an Israeli bulldozer crossing into Gaza and then lifting up his body.

Fawzi Barhoum, a Hamas spokesman, accused the Israeli military of abusing the dead body, saying that it ``bears the consequences of the ugly crime.''

The military said it was removing the body in a way that prevented further danger to those around.

But the images generated widespread anger in Gaza, where it was seen as a provocation and violation of Islamic principles that call for respect for the dead.

It also sparked criticism of Hamas on social media, with people accusing the group of appearing weak and allowing Israel to operate with impunity inside Gaza's territory. One image on social media showed a picture of Jesus draped with a Palestinian flag hanging off the front of a bulldozer.

Israeli Defense Minister Naftali Bennett rejected the criticism, noting that Hamas has been holding the bodies of two Israeli soldiers since they were killed in the 2014 Gaza war.

``I back the military, which killed the terrorists and collected the body,'' he said. ``That's what should be done and that is what was done.''

The incident comes amid a relative lull along the security fence separating Israel from Gaza. Last week, Israel announced it would provide hundreds of additional work permits for Palestinians in the Gaza Strip, in a new step aimed at solidifying an informal cease-fire with the Hamas.

Tens of thousands of Gazans used to work in Israel. But Israel virtually sealed the border when it joined Egypt in imposing a crippling blockade on Gaza after Hamas seized power in the strip from rival Palestinian forces in 2007. The blockade, along with three wars between Hamas and Israel, has devastated the economy in Gaza, where unemployment is over 50%.

Title: City student’s start-up pitch now in global challenge
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Thrinay Potta’s start-up pitch— ‘Hearing through teeth’ has been adjudged the best start-up pitch at Assocham (Associated Chambers of Commerce and Industry in India) Start-up Launchpad recently held in Visakhapatnam. His will be one of the start-ups that will represent TiE Amaravati at the TiE Global University challenge that will be held in San Francisco Bay Area in USA in May, 2020.

Thrinay, an engineering student of Gitam Deemed to be University, has been working on his start-up pitch to fix hearing impairment for the last eight years. He has developed an affordable device through which people will be able to hear through their teeth. The latest device produced by Thrinay is the 10th generation prototype.

Leben Johnson M, director of venture development centre (VDC) of Gitam’s institute for development of entrepreneurship said, “We wish Thrinay the very best and hope he brings back laurels from the Silicon Valley and maybe become the first unicorn from VDC.”

Johnson further said that the VDC was initiated to create an entrepreneurial ecosystem within campus, which is why Gitam has partnered with Northeastern University.

Title: YS Jaganmohan Reddy: 12 lakh students slated to benefit from Vasati Devena
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Vasati Devena will be launched by CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy on February 24 in Vizianagaram.

VISAKHAPATNAM: The Visakhapatnam district officials have identified about 1 lakh beneficiaries for the Jagananna Vasati Devena initiative, which will be launched by chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy on February 24 in Vizianagaram.

As per the initiative, while students of industrial training institute will get an annual financial assistance of Rs 10,000 for food and hostel expenses, diploma students will be given Rs 15,000. Those pursuing graduation and other higher education courses will receive Rs 20,000 per annum.

The new scheme will superseded the existing scholarship schemes. Earlier, students used to get the scholarship and other benefits through the welfare departments and college managements. But now the financial assistance will be directly credited to the bank accounts of the students.

In all, 11.87 lakh students will benefit under the new scheme, including nearly 57,000 students in Vizianagaram district.

According to the officials, the scheme would cost the exchequer about Rs 57 crore in Vizianagaram district, alone. The amount will be credited in two instalments. A minimum of 75% attendance is a must to avail the benefits under the scheme.

The scheme is applicable to all the government and private colleges in Andhra Pradesh .

The state government has constituted various committees at state and district level for better implementation of the scheme.

Title: YS Jaganmohan Reddy: 12 lakh students slated to benefit from Vasati Devena
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Vasati Devena will be launched by CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy on February 24 in Vizianagaram.

VISAKHAPATNAM: The Visakhapatnam district officials have identified about 1 lakh beneficiaries for the Jagananna Vasati Devena initiative, which will be launched by chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy on February 24 in Vizianagaram.

As per the initiative, while students of industrial training institute will get an annual financial assistance of Rs 10,000 for food and hostel expenses, diploma students will be given Rs 15,000. Those pursuing graduation and other higher education courses will receive Rs 20,000 per annum.

The new scheme will superseded the existing scholarship schemes. Earlier, students used to get the scholarship and other benefits through the welfare departments and college managements. But now the financial assistance will be directly credited to the bank accounts of the students.

In all, 11.87 lakh students will benefit under the new scheme, including nearly 57,000 students in Vizianagaram district.

According to the officials, the scheme would cost the exchequer about Rs 57 crore in Vizianagaram district, alone. The amount will be credited in two instalments. A minimum of 75% attendance is a must to avail the benefits under the scheme.

The scheme is applicable to all the government and private colleges in Andhra Pradesh .

The state government has constituted various committees at state and district level for better implementation of the scheme.

Title: 2000 Rs Note News: Indian Bank stops loading ATMs with Rs 2,000 notes
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

(Representative image)

BENGALURU: Public-sector entity Indian Bank has decided to stop loading its ATMs with Rs 2,000 notes, citing customer preferences. According to RBI data, Indian Bank had nearly 4,000 ATMs across India as of December 2019.

Indian Bank said it had a recurring problem with on-site ATMs (those located within a bank's branch).

"Customers would step into the branch as soon as they withdrew cash from the ATM, asking for Rs 2,000 notes to be exchanged for notes of smaller denomination. They were just crowding our branches with long queues. So, we have decided to do away with Rs 2,000 notes," said an Indian Bank official.

Of Indian Bank's 3,988 ATMs across India, 3,289 ATMs were on-site and 699 off-site. Going forward, Indian Bank ATMs will have only Rs 100, Rs 200 and Rs 500 notes.

On whether this move would continue after the merger with Allahabad Bank , Indian Bank officials said that it would depend on what the merged entity decides.

Title: YS Jaganmohan Reddy to inaugurate Disha police station today
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

YS Jaganmohan Reddy

VIZIANAGARAM: Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy will inaugurate a Disha police station in Vizianagaram on Monday.

The district administration has spent over Rs 1.2 crore for the construction of the police station. The police said a DSP-rank police officer along with an inspector, five sub-inspectors and 45 constables will run the police station.

Unlike other police stations, the Disha police station is housed in a corporate-looking building and is equipped with several facilities, including a waiting hall, separate office for the public prosecutor and a forensic laboratory.

Vizianagaram police chief B Raja Kumar said they have made all the security arrangements for the chief minister’s visit. As part of it, the police have imposed certain traffic restriction in Vizianagaram.

Title: On a mission: Bikers criss-cross country to raise cause of animals killed on roads
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Dabbiru Harish feeds stray dogs during his biking expedition from India to Nepal to raise awareness about dogs... Read More

Visakhapatnam: Dabbiru Harish embarked on his first biking expedition across south India last year to spread awareness about road safety. It was then that he came to know that hundreds of animals die in road accidents every year. In course of his ride, he witnessed a baby elephant get hit by a truck. He also saw a number of dogs lying dead on the roads.

That experience gave the 23-year-old Harish to take up his next ride themed around the message of saving animals. Harish and 28-year-old Goppu Chandra Sekhar went on an expedition from Visakhapatnam to Nepal. Titled ‘Asian Glimpse’, the biker-duo covered 4,500km across six states spreading the message that more needs to be done to ensure safety of animals on roads.

In course of their ride, they met people from Odisha, Jharkhand, Bihar, Sikkim, West Bengal as wells as Nepal. To them, they conveyed the necessity of saving animals. The entire expedition took 15 days to complete. Harish said that they also stopped to feed stray dogs around the places they were travelling.

“We met people from different cultures, languages. When we reached Chilka Lake, we went for a boat-ride where we spotted different migratory birds. We also spoke to fishermen about the threat plastic poses to marine life,” added Harish.

He further said that he saw more than 30 dogs lying dead on roads during the expedition. Now, the bikers are planning to cover the Golden Quadrilateral.

Title: Rly plans to start new Vizag-Araku tourist train
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Visakhapatnam: A dedicated regular train between Visakhapatnam and Araku Valley is likely to be on track soon. This, if it becomes a reality, will be the first tourism project under the aegis of South Coastal Railway (SCoR) which is slated to begin operations from the upcoming financial year.

The possibility of this project depends on two factors. First, if Visakhapatnam becomes the executive capital of Andhra Pradesh and second, if Visakhapatnam becomes the zonal headquarters of SCoR.

Currently, tourists are dependent on the 58501/58502 Visakhapatnam to Kirandul passenger train to go to Araku from the city. During the peak season, the railways run special trains from Visakhapatnam to Araku to meet the rush.

However, railway sources have indicated that authorities have in-principle decided to run a regular train from Visakhapatnam to Araku soon. DVM Reddy, the Visakhapatnam divisional manager of Andhra Pradesh tourism development corporation (APTDC) said that a regular train from Visakhapatnam to Araku will be a welcome step.

“Once the train is operational, we will ask the railways to allocate one or more coaches to APTDC which we will include in our tourism packages. We will pay the passenger fee directly to the railways,” Reddy said, while adding that APTDC has been asking for a regular train along this route since 2002.

A senior railway official told TOI that the announcement of a new train from Visakhapatnam to Araku will come along with the announcement of five Vistadome coaches. Right now, the existing Vistadome coach is connected to the Kirandul passenger train. The new train will have all Vistadome coaches, he added.

Title: Travel operators call for infra upgrade in Araku
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Visakhapatnam: With the Indian Railways planning to introduce ‘tourist-special’ trains with Vistadome coaches from Visakhapatnam to Araku Valley, travel agents and environmentalists are now asking the state government to upgrade the tourist infrastructure in the area as well as the entire state.

Speaking to TOI, Sohan Hatangdi, a city-based environmentalist said, “The heart of the (Araku) Valley is located within two to three kilometres from the railway station. This locale is extremely congested and there is no proper recreation for tourists. Decongesting the area should be the prime focus.”

Congestion in the valley’s downtown area, potholes on main roads, lack of displays in the tribal museum, an inadequate solid waste management system and mosquitoes have remained active concerns of tourists for quite some time.

Hatangdi further said that private hotels in the area lack proper waste management systems and dump their waste on the road in front of the hotel. “As a result, the roads don’t remain conducive for tourists wishing to take a stroll at night. Even walking on roads in Araku makes you face the wrath of mosquitoes,” he added.

According to Hatangdi, the area near the tribal museum is another problem. The area, he says, doesn’t have adequate displays. The environmentalist is of the opinion that if the railways are planning to introduce tourist special trains to Araku, then the infrastructure too should get an upgrade.

Travel agents, on the other hand, want Railways to change the train schedule. According to them, tourists visiting Visakhapatnam prefer to travel to Araku first and then visit the city. But the train with the Vistadome coach starts at 06:30am and tourists are compelled to stay a day in Visakhapatnam, a travel agent said.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Man stabs son to death in fight over rooster in Vizianagaram district
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: A 50-year-old man murdered his son over a dead rooster at Boddidi village under GL Puram Mandal in Vizianagaram district on Sunday.

Police said Addakula Kanta Rao took his rooster to the nearby pond for giving a bath but the rooster drowned. Kanta Rao’s son Majjiswara Rao had a heated argument with his father over the incident.

The police said Kanta got angry when his son questioned him and stabbed his son with a knife near the pond.

Although the neighbours took Majjiswara to the nearby government hospital for treatment but he was declared brought dead.

The police have taken the accused Kanta Rao into custody.

Title: Julian Assange: US to lay out case against Julian Assange at extradition trial
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

LONDON: The US government and WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange will face off on Monday in a London courthouse, a decade after WikiLeaks infuriated US officials by publishing a trove of classified military documents . A judge at Woolwich Crown Court will begin hearing arguments from lawyers for US authorities , who want to try Assange on espionage charges that carry a maximum sentence of 175 years in prison.

The extradition hearing follows years of subterfuge, diplomatic dispute and legal drama that have led the 48-year-old Australian from fame as an international secret-spiller through exile inside the Ecuadorian embassy in London to incarceration in a UK prison.

Assange has been indicted in the US on 18 charges over the publication of classified documents. Prosecutors say he conspired with US army intelligence analyst Chelsea Manning to hack into a Pentagon computer and release hundreds of thousands of secret diplomatic cables and military files on the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. US authorities say WikiLeaks’ activities put American lives in danger. Assange argues he was acting as a journalist and says the leaked documents exposed US military wrongdoing.

Title: Women, small towns, drive growth at Puma India
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

BENGALURU: Sports lifestyle brand Puma has seen its sales grow 22% to Rs 1,413 crore for the 12 months ending December 2019. The growth was aided by increasing sales to women customers and higher demand in tier-2 towns across the country despite a slowing economy.

The German multinational has roped in a slew of brand ambassadors like Virat Kohli and Mary Kom over the last few years. It expects to continue a similar growth momentum of over 20% this year even as it faces increasing competition from relatively newer entrants like Under Armour and Skechers. "India is a strategic market for Puma. The growing sportswear market, coupled with the country's aspirational youth, poses a huge opportunity for us to tap into," Bjorn Gulden, global CEO of Puma, told TOI .

He added that globally it has also been a record year for the brand with revenues of 5.5 billion euros.

"Being the No.1 brand in India is a reflection of how well we understand our consumers and how pleased they are with our products." Puma wants to double down on India, with plans to open about 20 exclusive stores in an existing network of 373 across the country. Puma was one of the first major brands to actively tap the online retail sales route on Flipkart and Amazon India. This channel accounted for around 29% of sales in 2019, compared to 24% in 2018. Puma's India MD Abhishek Ganguly sees this number stabilising at about 30%.

What has significantly been increasing sales for Puma is its business in tier-2 and -3 towns as it contributes 48% of the total online channel in 2019 from just 15% in 2015. These smaller towns - like Jalandhar, Bhopal and Nashik - also contributed 40% of the total offline sales in 2019 as compared to 22% in 2015. The competition in the segment is set to increase as Under Armour has opened 10 stores in India.

Title: 2,000-year-old Pavuralakonda heritage site lies in state of neglect
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Visakhapatnam: A group of around 20 trekking enthusiast medical students and doctors were in for a shock on Sunday morning when they climbed the hilltop Buddhist heritage site of Pavuralakonda near Bheemunipatnam only to be greeted by hundreds of broken alcohol bottles and plastic litter around the ruins of the 2,000-year-old Buddhist site .

At a time when the government has been talking about restoration and conservation of heritage sites like Thotlakonda, Bavikonda and Bojjanakonda, the Pavuralakonda site dating back to third and second century BCE seems to be completely forgotten.

Vivek Rathod from the Junior Chamber International (JCI), who organised Sunday’s trek, said the ancient Buddhist monastic complex lacks even a signage explaining its significance. “Forget security staff, there is not even a gate, proper fencing or approach road. The site lies completely neglected and is overgrown with weeds. Anti-social elements and drunkards seem to have made it their home. There are a few 17th century Dutch bungalows atop the hill which have been renovated, but the Buddhist relics like the ruins of stupas, circular chaityas, staircases, foundations of viharas lie in a shambles,” Rathod said.

Heritage narrator Jayshree Hatangadi, who is also a member of the Indian National Trust for Art and Cultural Heritage (Intach), said neglect of the ancient site is an insult to the state’s heritage.

“We have beach patrol these days and protecting historic sites from hooligans are aspects that the police should take care of. The government seems to be only doing lip service about the proposed Buddhist corridor. There is no board, no signage explaining the significance of the sites nor is there any conservation and renovation work,” Jayshree fumed.

When contacted, additional director of state archaeology department S Venkat Rao said the roads and buildings department plans to construct a 1.5km motorable road from the beach road which will connect the hilltop site.

“Once the road is laid, we can undertake restoration works at the site. Since no security staff has been allocated to my department to guard Pavuralakonda site, we will send a complaint to the Bheemili police and request them to patrol and prevent anti-social elements from using the ancient heritage site for drinking or other illegal activities,” he told TOI.

Title: Kolkata: Pool car owners want fee hike to make drivers toe the line
Content:
Bidhannagar officers address pool car drivers and owners

(With inputs from Mayukh Sengupta)

KOLKATA: A cop initiative to teach pool car owners and drivers to become responsible citizens ended up in the men in uniform being informed about some home truths by pool car owners, who openly admitted that very few drivers stick to safety, security and maintenance norms. The latter added that they would not be able to change the situation until they are allowed to raise the fees per student.The Bidhannagar Commissionerate had invited some 300-odd pool car owners from Salt Lake, Baguiati, Lake Town, New Town and areas surrounding airport for a day-long sensitization programme in the backdrop of the death of a Class-II student, Rishav Singh from Howrah, following a week-long struggle at SSKM Hospital after a pool car with 15 students travelling at a speed of 90kmph fell in a ditch beside Delhi Road on February 14. Rishav and another boy were admitted to the hospital where Rishav died of multi-organ failure on Saturday.However, at the sensitization programme, the pool car owners tried to defend themselves by saying that they carry excess number of students against the rulebook just to stay afloat in the competitive market.The one-and-a-half-hour programme at a banquet hall off VIP Road was attended by senior officers of Bidhannagar Commissonerate along with the officer-in-charge of all traffic guards under the commissionerate. The officers first showed a power point presentation to the pool car owners, highlighting their laxities and the areas they need to work on and then they addressed the issues in details to the drivers and owners. However, right after the meeting, the drivers told TOI as well as to some officers in person that the guidelines are difficult to meet.“The cops are asking us to leave our Maruti Omni cars and shift to a larger and safer vehicle. But we don’t earn enough to invest in another car now. Further, the cops have been constantly stressing on limiting the number of kids in the car. In order to do that, we need to increase the fees per kid, which the guardians will not agree to,” said Asish Ghosh, a pool car owner and driver.Another pool car owner, Manoj Debroy, said: “The cops are asking us to depute experienced drivers are also saying that we cannot club students of multiple schools together. But if we don’t do that, we cannot make enough profit to sustain the business. Further, we will have to shell out more to hire an experienced driver.”The cops, however, said they were following a two-pronged approach in which they would also conduct sensitization sessions at various schools and with guardians’ forums. “First, we are trying to sensitize and persuade the drivers and owners to stick to the norms set by the school education department and by us. The next step will be execution in which we will start prosecuting the owners and drivers who will not stick to guidelines,” said Dhritiman Sarkar, DC (traffic) of Bidhannagar Commissionerate.Sarkar added the commissionerate’ also plans to paste cop helpline numbers on every pool car.

Title: Mobile phone services restored as Afghan truce holds
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

KABUL: Mobile phone services were restored across swathes of Taliban-contested areas of Afghanistan over the weekend as a partial truce with the militants held for a second day. The Taliban, US and Afghan forces are currently overseeing a week-long “reduction in violence” that kicked off on Saturday.

The commitment has seen fighting drop dramatically and is set to pave the way for an American withdrawal deal to be signed later this week.

There have been reports of small clashes in rural areas, but no major attacks that have long defined the conflict have erupted. “In general we do see a reduction in violence,” acting interior minister Masood Andrabi said.

The lull in violence allowed telecom operators to begin restoring networks across the country that have long been hampered by fighting. “Around 730 cell towers have restarted,” said Naqeebullah Sailab, vice chairman of the Telecom Regulatory Authority of Afghanistan. “There are towers which started operating after almost five years.” Two separate officials with knowledge of the country’s telecoms industry in northern Afghanistan also confirmed that mobile networks were being restored in insurgent-hit areas.

The Taliban have long targeted Afghanistan’s private telecom firms, kidnapping engineers, destroying transmission masts and forcing regular coverage blackouts in volatile areas to avoid detection of their fighters. Afghanistan boasts millions of mobile users in a population of 30 million, with the fast-growing industry employing around 200,000 people and earning strong revenue in an otherwise moribund economy. Thousands of telecommunication towers, however, are in insurgency-hit areas and vulnerable to attacks.

The partial truce is expected to set the conditions for Washington and the insurgents to sign a deal in Doha on February 29 that could, ultimately, pull US troops out after more than 18 years and launch war-weary Afghanistan into an uncertain future.

Title: Jallikattu in Tamil Nadu: Three bull-tamers gored to death during jallikattu
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

PLAYING WITH DANGER: Action during a jallikattu event at Nagiyampatti village near Thamampatti in Salem on Sun... Read More

Salem/Madurai/Coimbatore: A 32-year-old bull-tamer, who was hospitalised after being injured during jallikattu at Thamampatti in Salem on Saturday, died on Sunday, while two more bull-tamers were gored to death in Dindigul and Coimbatore districts.

Police identified the deceased in Salem incident as Prabhakaran alias Kanagaraj of Pudukottai. At least 20 bull-tamers were admitted to hospitals with injuries suffered at the event in which more than 550 bulls and 350 tamers took part. In jallikattu at Thottanoothu in Dindigul, Nagaraj, 21, of Vellaputhur suffered injury. He later died at Dindigul GH. Subash Chandra Bose, 26, of Viralimalai, died in Coimbatore event.

Title: A 9-year-old asks Buttigieg: Will you help me tell the world I’m gay too
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Democratic presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg welcomed a nine-year-old boy on stage at a rally in Denver, Colorado, on Saturday night after the young boy asked the former mayor of South Bend, Indiana, for help coming out as gay. “Would you help me tell the world I’m gay too,” the boy wrote in a pre-submitted question that was read to Buttigieg. “I want to be brave like you.”

Buttigieg, who is the first major openly gay presidential candidate, was momentarily speechless. The crowd, numbering in the thousands, started to cheer “love is love,” as the boy, Zachary , was brought onto the stage. “Well, I don’t think you need a lot of advice from me,” Buttigieg told Zachary. “You seem pretty strong to me. It took me a long time to figure out how to tell even my best friend that I was gay.”

Buttigieg, who was then joined on stage by his husband, Chasten , didn’t come out as gay until his 30s, during his first term as mayor of South Bend, Indiana. “It won’t always be easy, but that’s OK because you know who you are,” Buttigieg told Zachary. “And that’s really important because when you know who you are, you have a centre of gravity that can hold you together when all kinds of chaos is happening around you.”

Buttigieg also lauded young Zachary’s courage, telling him others might decide “they can be a little braver because you have been brave... I want you to know even if I can’t promise it’ll always be easy, I can promise you that I’m going to be rooting for you.” The rally was Buttigieg’s first stop after Nevada ’s caucuses on Saturday in which he finished third.

Title: Chennai: 19-year-old BTech student found dead in college
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: A nineteen-year-old BTech student was found dead in her room at the hostel of SRM university at Potheri on Saturday.

Police said Ayushi Rana from Punjab was found hanging by fellow students who peeped through the window when she didn't come out for a long while. Her suicide is the fourth in the last year at the Potheri campus.

The Maraimalai Nagar police said Ayudhi Rana did not leave behind any suicide note and they were investigating the reason behind the death.

On July 17, director-general of police J K Tripathy, had ordered a CB-CID probe into the deaths on the campus as three students had committed suicide between May 26 and July 15 On July 15, Sree Raghav, a final year BTech student from Kanyakumari committed suicide by jumping from the seventh floor of the SRM college building.

On May 26, a final year bio-medicine student Anupriya from Tiruvallur committed suicide by jumping from the eighth floor of her hostel.

Title: Sanders wins Nevada caucus, takes lead in Democratic race
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

LAS VEGAS: Broad-based support across age, racial and ideological groups propelled Bernie Sanders to a dominant victory in Nevada ’s Democratic caucuses, tightening his grip on the front-runner spot in the race to find a challenger to President Donald Trump .

Joe Biden, a former vicepresident, appeared headed to a badly needed second-place finish in Nevada after poor showings earlier this month in the first two nominating contests in the Democratic presidential race ahead of the November 3 election. Sanders’ triumph on Saturday in the first racially diverse state in the campaign suggested he was reaching a broader coalition of Democratic voters with his unapologetic message of social and economic justice, including his signature pledge to provide universal healthcare for all Americans.

For Biden and other moderates who argue Sanders is too liberal to beat Trump and who have been trying to blunt his momentum, however, the Nevada results made the job much harder. “We have put together a multi-generational, multiracial coalition that is going to not only win in Nevada, it’s going to sweep the country,” Sanders, a US senator from Vermont and self-described democratic socialist, told cheering supporters in Texas .

He then turned his attention to Trump. “We are going to win across the country because the American people are sick and tired of a president who lies all of the time,” he said. Trump speaking to reporters said Nevada was a “great win” for Sanders, adding that he did not care who his opponent would be.

By Sunday morning, with 50% of the precincts reporting, Sanders had 47% of the county convention delegates in Nevada. Biden was a distant second to Sanders with 19%, but ahead of former mayor of South Bend, Indiana, Pete Buttigieg , in third place with 15%. “The press is ready to declare people dead quickly, but we're alive and we're coming back and we're gonna win,” Biden told supporters in Las Vegas on Saturday night.

In a pre-recorded interview set to air on Sunday on CBS, Biden said he was confident he could win the next contest on Saturday in South Carolina with support from African-Americans, according to a transcript. Senator Elizabeth Warren, who had been looking to jump-start her campaign after poor finishes in Iowa and New Hampshire , trailed in a disappointing fourth place with 10% in Nevada. Senator Amy Klobuchar and activist billionaire Tom Steyer were well back at 5% and 4%, respectively.

The race now begins to broaden across the country, with the South Carolina primary followed closely by the Super Tuesday contests in 14 states on March 3 that pick more than one-third of the pledged delegates who will help select a Democratic nominee. The Super Tuesday states will be the first nominating contests for former New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg, who has not been competing in the four early voting states but had been rising in opinion polls

Title: Thousands booked in midnight raids to make Kolkata roads safer
Content:
Breathalyzer test on a motorcyclist in north Kolkata on Saturday night

KOLKATA: As many as 2,586 persons were booked for various offences on road — 1,915 of them for dangerous driving and 671 for disorderly conduct — during a police drive between 9pm on Saturday night and 1am on Sunday at all prominent intersections in the city.The “block raids” were conducted simultaneously at 50-odd points across the city, with officers of police stations and traffic guards, led by divisional DCs, prosecuting traffic rule violators and law-and-order offenders.Of those booked, more than 1,500 were riding twowheelers. Cops said this was the first block raid conducted in the city this month, as the winter is slowly withering away and with the onset of spring, more people are hitting the streets at night with two-wheelers, posing hazard to themselves as well as others.“During winter, instances of dangerous driving involving two-wheelers remains comparatively low, but now that the summer is approaching, more and more rogue bikers are hitting the road. That resulted in the large number of offenders being prosecuted during the midnight raid. From now on, we will organise more late-night naka checks, especially against rash driving by two-wheelers and drink driving,” said a senior Kolkata Police officer.Of the 1,495 bikers who were prosecuted, 986 were not wearing helmets and 509 were triple-riding. Five vehicles were seized. In all, 155 were driving or riding under influence. According to police, 105 were prosecuted for rash driving and another 671 were booked for disorderly conduct.According to police, the block raids were conducted in areas under the jurisdiction of Kolkata Police.The drive was supervised by senior officers like divisional commissioners, assistant commissioners and officers in charge of various police stations, detective department and traffic department. The officers even raided hideouts of offenders based on intelligence inputs and set up naka posts across the city.“It is a sustained but impromptu drive which will be taken up often. Nabbing some of the known criminals as preventive arrest is also a part of the drive,” said a senior officer of Kolkata Police.During the surprise raids, police also raided some hotels, night clubs and illegal liquor dens, arrested 31 trouble-mongers and seized around 305 litres of illegal liquor. Armed with breathalysers and speed guns, cops posted at the check posts scanned over 5,000 bikes and cars.

Title: Ahmedabad: Man films woman taking bath, FIR filed
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A 30-year-old woman from Sabarmati on Saturday filed a complaint with Sabarmati Riverfront West police alleging that a man captured her video while she was taking a bath.

The woman, said she was taking bath in the bathroom, which does not have a ceiling . At that moment she saw a phone was placed on the wall. "I realized that someone was shooting me so I hurriedly dressed and came out. When I was about to take the cellphone, a man who lives in the same vicinity named Jayesh tried to take it away," states the FIR. The man told the woman that it was his cellphone and someone else had placed it on her bathroom. But the woman found that there was a video of her taking bath . Police have registered a case of voyeurism along with sections under IT Act .

Title: Guv to attend WBSU convocation on Feb 25
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Kolkata: Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar will, in his capacity as chancellor, preside over the convocation of West Bengal State University (WBSU) on Tuesday. He had earlier missed two opportunities in December and January to attend the convocations of Jadavpur University and Calcutta University due to protests staged by a section of students.

On Sunday, Dhankhar tweeted that he would be attending the convocation on February 25. “Would avail the opportunity to discuss with VC and faculty how University may be ever on the rise,” said the post.

The governor, an official said, has been invited by WBSU vice-chancellor Basab Chaudhuri and by the state government to preside over the convocation.

During the JU and CU convocations, Dhankhar had to face protests, following which he had said he was pained on being denied the opportunity to fulfil his duty as chancellor. Recently, the governor had tweeted he was kept in the dark about the Cooch Behar Panchanan Barma University convocation held on February 14.

This story is from February 24, 2020

Title: Houses, shops set ablaze as Trinamool man dies
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Jalpaiguri: Hours after a Trinamool Congress activist died in hospital on Saturday following an attack, suspected party workers went on the rampage at Churabhandar in Maynaguri in this north Bengal district setting ablaze 10 houses and some shops on Sunday evening.

Around 20 BJP supporters were said to be injured in the attack at Churabhandar, which is said to be a saffron-party stronghold where Prime Minister Narendra Modi had held a rally on February 8, 2019.

Trinamool activist Bhombal Ghosh (34) was hacked on February 14, allegedly by BJP workers, and he died at North Bengal Medical College Hospital (NBMCH) on Saturday evening. Police said Ghosh had suffered a severe head injury.

A BJP worker, Tapas Roy, was arrested on Sunday, and police have filed an FIR against 15 men, including a Tripura Police personnel.

BJP workers alleged that the attack on the houses of party workers started in the presence of police after Roy’s arrest.

Violence broke out after Ghosh’s body was brought to Churabhandar from NBMCH, and Trinamool functionaries, alleged BJP activists, delivered a virulent speech against BJP blaming its workers for the death.

Later, Trinamool supporters put up a blockade in the area preventing police from reaching the trouble spot.

Trinamool Youth Congress district president Saikat Chatterjee ruled out the involvement of his party workers in any violence. He said it was the result of an internal feud in BJP.

BJP’s Shyam Pradhan, however, said Ghosh was killed due to infighting in Trinamool and saffron-party workers were subsequently implicated in the murder.

Jalpaiguri SP Abhishek Modi said a strong police force has been deployed to control the situation.

Title: Anthrax ruled out as cause of 4 rhino deaths
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Jalpaiguri: The forest department has ruled out anthrax as the cause of four rhino deaths at Jaldapara national park last week. “We sent viscera samples to Belgachhia lab and a private lab. The results were negative for anthrax,” a senior forester said.

The department has, however, stopped elephant safari in the park till Thursday to keep a watch on kunki elephants vaccinated over fears of an anthrax outbreak.

“The department needs to identify the disease and take measures at the earliest,” said environmentalist Shyama Prasad Pandey of Society for Protecting Ophiofauna and Animal Rights.

Title: Abbey?! Em Ledu: This comedy-of-errors makes for a fun watch
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Play: Abbey?! Em Ledu

Director: Vinay Varma

Written by: Sankaramanchi Parthasarathy

Cast: V Kiran Kumar, Deepika Mahidara, Hrudai Raghav, Shyam Krishna Govindh, Zaheer Ahmed, Rahul C, Surya G

Duration: 45 minutes

Language: Telugu

Rating: 3/5

Plot: V Kiran Kumar’s Shankar Rao was trying to have a peaceful weekend at home. Having lost a valuable ring, his wife, Deepika (played by Deepika Mahidara) disrupts his relaxed mood. Shankar is quick to suspect their deaf and ill cook, Satti Babu, who his wife treats like a sibling. Shankar sends his wife away to visit a few relatives and promises to find her lost ring. In the meantime, Shankar’s boss drops by and the duo decide to have fun. After the party starts, two thieves break into the house and a sequence of confusion and chaos ensues.

Review: The play opens in Shankar Rao’s living room and most of it takes place there itself. Shankar’s interactions with his wife, Deepika and boss, Gangadharan, fail to entertain at first. But the play soon takes an interesting turn with the entry of the thieves, Ram and Vasu. While V Kiran Kumar, Deepika Mahidara and Rahul C as Vasu are decent enough in their roles, Zaher Ahmed as Ram and Hrudai Raghav as Satti Babu are impressive. However, Shyam Krishna Govindh’s character, Gangadharan, is a letdown. His dialogues are riddled with clichés, like the overused enda guruvayurappa. His dialogue delivery could use some work as well. But the writer Sankraramanchi Parthasarathy has to be commended for making the audience laugh, even in a low comedy play like this. Minimalist lighting and the sounds used during some key scenes added to their effectiveness. The play was executed with minimal errors by the cast and makes for a good watch.

Verdict: This is Sutradhar’s first attempt at a Telugu play and they sure did pack a punch. However, while the play in itself was entertaining, there is still scope for improvement and areas they can work on as a unit. The writing and dialogue delivery, in particular, can be improved. Better lighting could have enhanced the visual appeal of this play as well. But having said that, an excellent cast and some good performances make Abbey?! Em Ledu a fun watch.

Title: Indo-Korean: An Indo-Korean performance leaves city folk mesmerised
Content: Music and dance connoisseurs were in for a treat as an envious list of artists from India and Korea came together to put up an electrifying performance at Shilpakala Vedika recently.Titled ‘Same Same But Different’, the exciting collaboration brought together Noreum Machi, a Korean percussionist group, Indian dancer Astad Deboo, an ensemble of three Indian musicians, Tarayam, percussionist BC Manjunath, singer and flautist Varijashree Venugopal and percussionist, composer and music director, Praveen D Rao.Those in attendance, including guest of honour, HE Joel Reifman, US Consul General, Hyderabad, were pleasantly surprised by how the different strands and styles still managed to complement each other and converge well. The artists performed here as part of a four city tour.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Couple die after woman sets herself on fire
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: A couple died on Saturday night after a woman allegedly set herself on fire over a domestic dispute. The man was trying to rescue her. Both sustained 90% burn injuries, said police.

Initially, police believed that the fire could have spread from a mosquito coil after the couple's children told them that they saw their parents on fire. But after questioning a neighbour, police found out that the woman had poured kerosene and set herself on fire.

Police said, Shanthi, 32, was married to Ilango, 36, with two children.

On Saturday, hearing the two scream, neighbours rushed to their house. They took them to the hospital where doctors declared them 'brought dead'.

"The neighbours had heard the couple fighting earlier," said an investigating officer.(Assistance for those having suicidal thoughts is available on Tamil Nadu's health helpline 104 and Sneha's suicide prevention helpline 044-24640050.)

Title: Kolkata Suicide: Cops save musician attempting suicide live on social media
Content:
The area where the musician tried to kill himself

KOLKATA: A 28-year-old musician, who had gone live on Facebook at his residence in Haltu early on Sunday, threatening to commit suicide, was saved by local police after they were informed about it by one of his friends. The latter had dialled the Lalbazar police headquarters as soon as he watched his friend on the social networking site around 1.30am saying that he was about to end his life. Within minutes, Garfa PS received a call from Lalbazar and policemen set out to locate the musician’s residence. They managed to get him out of his room and counselled him for about an hour and a half.The youngster told the police that he was frustrated at not being able to make a mark as a musician. He has a band, but doesn’t earn enough to support himself. According to his mother, the musician dropped out of college after an accident and was enrolled in a distance-education course. “My son has been into music for the last 10 years. He had a band that broke up after which he has managed to form another one. But he dreams to make it big. Unfortunately, he has been struggling for a long time and has been depressed. He barely earns enough to support himself,” said his mother, who works as a physiotherapist. They have been living at his maternal uncle’s home ever since his father went missing form their earlier residence at Behala two years ago.A Garfa PS officer said they received a call from a friend of the musician who told them that he was about to commit suicide. “We immediately sent a team of cops who found the house using GPS and got him out of his bedroom, where he had locked himself,” said the officer.

Title: Coronavirus in Mangalore: Foreign fund row, Manipal lab can’t test coronavirus
Content:
Representative image

ICMR sanctioned funds for Nipah virus research: Lab

‘ICMR chief cleared tie-up with US entity’

MANGALURU/BENGALURU: The Manipal Institute of Virology (MIV) that played a pivotal role in testing Nipah virus cases in 2018 is nowhere in the scheme of things in preventing the spread of coronavirus in the country.While the laboratory was dropped from the list of viral research and diagnostic laboratories (VRDLs) maintained by the Indian Council for Medical Research (ICMR) since July 2019, the ministry of home affairs in January this year suspended its Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) 2010 account alleging it had carried out Nipah virus research using foreign funds.The lab played a big role in 2018 when the Nipah Virus (NiV) disease broke out in Kerala. ICMR and Union health ministry appreciated the lab in 2018 by for diagnosing the virus and working on its surveillance. The lab tested 367 persons and found 18 of them positive. All cases were from Kerala.MIV began as Manipal Centre for Viral Research (MCVR) in 2010 and was the first private lab to be supported by ICMR for establishing Grade 1 Virus Diagnostic and Research Laboratory. MIV is part of the Manipal Academy of Higher Education .With MCVR removed from ICMR’s list of viral research & diagnostic laboratories, no samples of suspected coronavirus cases are being sent to it.The lab’s travails began in April 2019 when ICMR said the Nipah Virus Disease (NiVD) was a biosafety level-4 pathogen and Manipal lab was only a biosafety level-2 lab and it should not be eligible to collect, store and test suspected NiVD samples.Denying the latest allegations from the home ministry that it had carried out Nipah virus research using foreign funds, MIV director Dr G Arunkumar said MAHE had, in its reply to the ministry, clarified that only ICMR funds were used and they have all letters and transactions to support their claim. “MIV has not received any response and the account continues to be suspended,” he said.“MAHE has responded to the government stating that we have not used any foreign contribution for Nipah virus testing. Every 15 days, the university has filed a report on foreign fund transactions. None of these will stop us from doing good work. We are not doing anything to do with bioterrorism,” said Dr Arunkumar. He said ICMR sanctioned specific funds to MIV for conducting the Nipah virus diagnostic testing and outbreak investigation on May 28, 2018.ICMR had last year directed that MIV restrict processing of pathogens specific to biosafety level 2. However, Dr G Arunkumar, director, MIV, said coronavirus testing is under bio-safety level 2.ICMR also took objection to the lab’s collaboration with the United States-Centre for Diseases Control and Prevention (US-CDC). “No research activity funded by foreign funding agencies like CDC should be undertaken without approval from ICMR, health ministry screening committee,” it said.“The collaborations with US-CDC were reviewed every quarter by a committee cochaired by the director general of health services and the director-general of ICMR, under the Global Health Security Agenda in the ministry of health and family welfare, government of India,” Dr Arunkumar said.An ICMR official dealing with MIV matters did not respond to calls from TOI.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Woman’s lover beats her son, 4, to death
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: A four-year-old boy from Tirunelveli was murdered by his mother's paramour because he revealed their extramarital affair to his father. A Lokesh, 4, who was beaten up mercilessly by Sorimuthu, the paramour, on Friday, died in hospital on Sunday not responding to treatment.

The Melapalayam police have picked up the boy's mother Deepa, 28, for questioning and are searching for her paramour. The police said they were yet to register an FIR, but they are likely to register a case under IPC section 302 - punishment for murder.

Deepa's husband Antony Prakash, a truck driver, fell in love with Deepa, from Pollachi in Coimbatore district , and married her in 2015. The couple settled in Antony's native village in Vickramansingapuram .

Deepa began an extra-martial relationship with Sorimuthu, 25, from the same village. The two went to a private lodge in Tirunelveli city when Prakash went away on work. When he came to know that she was not at home, he grew suspicious and asked her to make a video call on Whatsapp. But she did not call him, police said.

The two had locked Lokesh outside the room and earlier Sorimuthu had even slapped the boy.

When Antony made a phone call to his wife's number, the boy picked it up and narrated what was going on at the lodge and how he was treated, police said.

When the two came to know about this, Sorimuthu thrashed the boy, which left him unconscious.

They took him to Tirunelveli government medical college hospital and Sorimuthu went into hiding. After the boy died, the police picked up the mother. Police sources said Deepa too will be charged with murder.

Title: India vs New Zealand 1st Test Highlights: New Zealand crush India by 10 wickets
Content:
Hanuma Vihari walks off dejected after losing his wicket at the Basin Reserve in Wellington. (Reuters Photo)

SCORECARD

|

New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson

Indian skipper

Virat Kohli

Man of the Match Tim Southee

New Zealand needed 10 balls to knock these runs off! This is a thumping win for New Zealand against the number one ranked side in the world. Right from the word go, it was the Kiwis who bossed this game. Yes, they were lucky on Day 1 as they won the toss, opted to bowl in conditions which were the best to bowl in, in this Test match, however, they made excellent use of it and bundled the Indians out for just 165. Jamieson was the star for them as he shone on debut with a four-wicket haul. Southee too took four but Jamieson's scalps included, Kohli, Pujara, Vihari and Sharma.

New Zealand managed to form a lot of handy stands and a couple of big ones. Captain Kane Williamson was their top scorer. There were three batters who got off to starts. However, it was an overall batting effort by them and that effort took their lead to close to 183. For India, they did not have the same conditions to bowl which the Kiwis had but their bowlers did look off color. Bumrah and Shami both were disappointing, Sharma and Ashwin though did a decent job, especially the former who bagged a fifer.

India failed to cross the 200-run mark in their second innings as well. Agarwal was the only one who showed some fight with a 50 but no other batsman managed to cross the 30-run mark. However, they did manage to take a lead and make the Kiwis bat again but it was a slender one which the hosts managed to knock out in no time.

New Zealand bowlers were exceptional second time around as well. Trent Boult did the job on Day 3 and it was Tim Southee who starred on Day 4. The former ended with a four-wicket haul and the latter with a five-wicket haul. Southee finished with 9 wickets in the game. Also, the Kiwis stuck to a plan in this innings which worked out brilliantly for them. In the end, it was a combined effort by the New Zealand side to take an unassailable lead in this series.

Title: Mumbai News: French businessman falls to death from duct of ninth floor flat
Content:
This story is from February 24, 2020

Representative image

NAVI MUMBAI: A 29-year-old French national died after falling into the open duct in the dry area attached to the bathroom of his ninth floor apartment at Greenscape Building in sector 46, Seawoods. The incident came to light on Sunday morning.

Senior inspector, Tanvir Shaikh, of NRI coastal police station said, "The deceased, Charyl Tastet, resided with his wife Tanya Thakur. The couple had got married a year ago. As Charyl's birthday was on February 21, they had celebrated at a restaurant on Saturday and returned home late. Charyl's friend from France had stayed overnight with them." Shaikh said Charyl was employed with a Spanish company and worked from home.

It is suspected that early Sunday, he went to the dry area attached to the bathroom and probably slipped and fell into the open duct and landed on the third floor. DCP (zone-1), Pankaj Dahane , said, "Prima facie foul play has been ruled out and an accidental death case registered."
